clinical_study.brief_title: MERIT-2: Macitentan in thE tReatment of Inoperable Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (OL)
clinical_study.official_title: Long Term, Multicenter, Single-arm, Open-label Extension Study of the MERIT-1 Study, to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Macitentan in Subjects With Inoperable Chronic Thromboembolic Pulmonary Hypertension (CTEPH)

brief_summary.textblock: Long-term study to evaluate if macitentan is safe, tolerable and efficient enough to be used for treatment of inoperable chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension (CTEPH)

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: AEs during treatment period and up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation
primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to each scheduled time point in exercise capacity, as measured by the 6MWD
Change from baseline to each scheduled time point in Borg dyspnea index
Proportion of subjects with worsening of WHO FC from baseline to each scheduled time point.
marked laboratory abnormalities during treatment period and up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in vital signs (blood pressure , heart rate) and body weight from baseline to all assessed time points during the study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline up to 30 days after study drug discontinuation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject with CTEPH having completed the double-blind (DB) AC-055E201/ MERIT-1 study as scheduled (i.e., who remained in the DB study up to Week 24).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Permanent discontinuation of DB study treatment due to an hepatic adverse event or liver aminotransferase abnormalities.
- Any known factor (e.g., drug or substance abuse) or disease (e.g., unstable psychiatric illness) that, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with treatment compliance or interpretation of the results, or that may influence the ability to comply with any of the study requirements.
